data.text: A situation that requires a choice between options that are or seem equally unfavorable or unsatisfactory.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A problem that seems to defy a satisfactory solution.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An argument that presents two alternatives, each of which has the same consequence.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A form of argument in which it is shown that whoever maintains a certain proposition must accept one or other of two alternative conclusions, and that each of these involves the denial of the proposition in question.
A difficult or doubtful choice; a state of things in which the alternatives appear to be equally bad or undesirable.
An argument which presents an antagonist with two or more alternatives, but is equally conclusive against him, whichever alternative he chooses.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: A state of things in which evils or obstacles present themselves on every side, and it is difficult to determine what course to pursue; a vexatious alternative or predicament; a difficult choice or position.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: alternatives, each of which is equally difficult of encountering.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: A <xref>circumstance</xref> in which a choice must be made between two or more <xref>alternatives</xref> that seem equally <xref>undesirable</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: this sense) (disputed) A difficult circumstance or <xref>problem</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.
